84618EF4DD934EF68BCD11CB451FD7AB.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

0806D80A11544B15A1BC187CBA040EAB.description: Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

D1128B0DD6C649619CD0D75A85DBF174.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

5A85B7322AF54257970706E5760C2D2E.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with a variety of partners about developmentally appropriate topics in small and larger groups.

388681BE8DFF4C6FBEC90615869D0D10.description: Use new words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, being read to, and responding to texts in order to express themselves precisely, clearly, and fluently through multiple forms of communication.

402519BF0AB04E0CB063BEC75BEA223F.description: With guidance and support from the teacher, demonstrate understanding, word relationships and nuances in word meanings. a. Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent. b. Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes). c. Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy). d. Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings. e. Sort words with beginning letter A-B-C order.Clarification: A-B-C order, while not specifically addressed in a singular benchmark, the explicit applciation of this skill lays the foundation for future use of reference materials.

D25E41C9EEB544CD857546DCF370AB36.description: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

038F22F011B54F7DA23C580E2EE218D1.description: Use frequently occurring prefixes and suffixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

BF9A4CAE782544D1B20FF80BE56CB485.description: Use sentence, picture, story context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

C7395AE203014A919408BD66125654AF.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies. Students will acquire new vocabulary using the following explicitly taught strategies:

53AD033944224968963BDC2EA978216B.description: From Kindergarten b. Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

8448791E89CF41BA914A053875599338.description: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

64D39A7A61ED4385BEA69BE1E092B9EB.description: Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

F932F562B7C74E3EB1EC79FEA2823F8D.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

99864E49F29440C39791EC84B0809A59.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

3D7A4CB74F944489AD2AD8130C8B7BA7.description: Use developmentally appropriate conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

B37B227CE8054F00A2BB7D62A7EDE812.description: Produce and expand complete simple interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences.

3908EA8E63C04789B0F5CBC535A06840.description: Use conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because) correctly.

A31719D1A1604527BA7800664B97BFE6.description: Use adjectives expand an idea or add detail.

2AFF781459A9437B85525B3ED8A66E7C.description: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

0685262D4B85489A921DBDB62693B78E.description: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their, anyone, everything) correctly.

46828EE79F724975B48D363B63B7D8E0.description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop) correctly.

4969DE3D2F6F485F9E9C6F5485F822AB.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns correctly.

B60C6E9F3E914C79A4291E942C0325C5.description: Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate fluency ofconventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing and/or speaking.

9B8C8B7408B24C3AB98AB77CAE40A38A.description: Students will be able to legibly print three complete detailed sentences on a topic that uses correct capitalization and end punctuation.

4DBC1D4B1C28499E8BFF2190B930D255.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

59F2A8D3329048498CF4CFB8576BB7D9.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of “how-to” books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

29B2A10C66394360B59697FD97DF18EB.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

316FE6FCD2E94018A0BAE8951761BD12.description: Students will explore the use of a variety of digital devices to create and share text both individually and collaboratively.

97C36238009B4D8D84B1099AD150E4CC.description: Using teacher-led modeling, students will understand how written text can be made better with revising and editing; i.e. suggestions, ideas, questions, etc. about the text. Example: "I think you need to say what color the car is."

4527835A1FEF46A5B82D7855FF968F7B.description: Students will be able to print all upper and lower case letters with automaticity by the completion of the 1st grade year.

47B8CF3C207145F58841D56A0E549D34.description: Write a three-sentence narrative in which events are sequenced, include details and use words such as first, next, and last, to signal event order.

13A14306C01F495E9B2B7F388C561CD6.description: Through a progression moving from the contruction of a single sentence to at least three related sentences, students will sharefacts and information in writing.

AA334E5E90544043882052EBFB0384BC.description: Through a progression moving from the contruction of a single sentence to at least three related sentences, students will express their opinions in writing.

C5EC0F8223EF48D99AF76094DC9CFD28.description: With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

D3F1DEFDD97C44CCA161CD692703CBAA.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F314F98BE86D41DAAC4148EA12D8E58B.description: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

ABFFBA82187E4CBB885C7C15EA8913CD.description: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

A397A12E42F94EDF81F4B3A13189D68A.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

21F2F0E7EFE64E3E82F149A3CD9EA416.description: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.

20F9310B63DA409FBE5BE2747972BD2F.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

D9419902768044FE94EA47840B9EF2B0.description: Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

F3885479F4974237AADA2B46ED356792.description: Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

73A9BD3081FD496EA9AE5DFB88D1E762.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

753D38CB5EBF415F8561E5342C21EF4E.description: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

955A4B870C1D406881FE315507F566F9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D459F4E0B26547AA85C237BC4CEB508E.description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

06A3D4F93FF74A6685B411D3C5051D9D.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

B2EEAACA10004D89B98EFFDA1EDB4442.description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

18514F1283A84CD4BAC1263C1538E314.description: Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

3441038901DB42E58AA8DD1E996AFBE3.description: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

81D556C45EF047428A0933791790C406.description: Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

BE5FC17FFB1E4200B71CDB82D3E6244C.description: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

C0BFAE3D41F841C0A8940649C41DA9D8.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

7E1BBA7E45FC4B90A0B35957CD0DA75F.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

DD6B0002E71A4838A10C2F77ADC4A8B4.description: Fluently read connected text at a rate of 60 Words Correct Per Minute (WCPM) with greater than 90% accuracy (50th percentile).For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

D48CD6B99164412B814377728DD34AB0.description: Fluently read a range of high frequency words (25-49) in a minute.

9F27F49758B346C1888CF0A3A5E1CA38.description: Fluently read nonsense words (15-27) in a minute.

DBDFA4CF948443B8968728D39CB65960.description: Fluently articulate individual phonemes in nonsense words (55-86).

583958F25FCE4391969822FC75F9E209.description: Students will be able to with speed and accuracy:

657F57FA5F2843658D23B41DE3F8B88E.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

2228C109D2A34EE09409E2FF8994F55F.description: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

1B0498C850B4411C9FD9F4C4E76224B9.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency.

47CD0F73FD174E00BE6B71716799F239.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

4ECEDE15B17E43BEA2DA802788D8B63F.description: Decode multi-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

E00B490D90804D628E37EA130E1F1346.description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

EFAB3CE4048F43ED9F126BAC082A9C82.description: Know graphemes can have silent letters (ex. kn, gn, wr).

D459D3F8D4FF41288BFD4D21CFD43657.description: Know dipthong vowel spelling conventions (ex. ow, oi, oy, oo)

2A46DE79F8F44ADDB24D6C3CE297980A.description: Know words with r-controlled vowel spelling conventions (ex. ar, or, er, ur, ir)

C86585B4673D4BB69D99DA4B4E64DA15.description: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

370860C35BF7497EB02A70A4E8A30190.description: Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs and beginning/ final blends.

90631F342D0C44F4A8344E969776E283.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

B9C9632395AA4006BD06DF5DA3B203A6.description: Orally segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

1672CFEC9ECA466290FADC30FD4AF6F7.description: Orally isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in single-syllable words.

D55FAB27B46B48C183A4F2F68403F0E5.description: Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

032478444DF14C588F99D2708CF32474.description: Orally Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in single-syllable words.

A397262F53AD4B78BE979F4F271895BF.description: Demonstrate understanding of syllables and sounds orally (phonemes)

8D6697C473F64BF79381B03B4726FA8E.description: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

D4F837FB725549A8B2BAE9A4EEB798C8.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
